      Recommends
      Positive Outlook
      Approves of CEO

      I have been working at L3 Technologies full-time (Less than a year)

      Pros

      They care about their employees.

      Cons

      Getting time is hard due to being under staffed

      Advice to Management

      Hire additional people so we can have time off. What’s good about 4 weeks of vacation if it’s like pulling teeth to take it.

      L3 Technologies 2019-01-05 14:58 PST

    Interviewing at L3 Technologies

    1. Jan 22, 2013

       

      Aircraft Mechanic Interview

      Anonymous Employee in Waco, TX
      Accepted Offer
      Easy Interview

      Application

      I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at L3 Technologies (Waco, TX).

      Interview

      For an Aircraft structures & sheetmetal mechanic there is very little to the interview process at L-3 Waco. I don't even remember it! I think I was asked maybe less than 5 very basic, non-threatening questions. More than anything they just want to hire as many people as they can as quickly as they can who they suspect might have the smallest ability to perform the simple job functions here.…  Your training is very much on-the-job and you'll learn and grow while working very quickly. Almost anyone can do it & an A&P isn't required but you'll get paid a few extra dollars if you have it.Show More

      Interview Questions

      • Ha! There were NO difficult or unexpected questions.   Answer Question

      Negotiation

      Take it or leave it! If you have many years of aircraft maintenance experience in structures & sheetmetal you can probably negotiate, but I was green when I first went to L-3.

      L3 Technologies 2013-01-22 11:48 PST
    See All 490 Interviews

    Company Updates

    • http://glassdoor.com/slink.htm?key=vQhpn

      —30+ days ago
      L3 Technologies on LinkedIn: "Today we announced that a five-year contract option has been exercised by the Canadian government for L3 MAS to continue providing complete In-Service Support (ISS) services to the Department of National Defence (DND) CC-150 Polaris fleet. The contract renewal, with a total potential value of $230 million, reflects L3 MAS' commitment to Canada's new Sustainment Business Case Analysis (SBCA) framework and Sustainment Initiative (SI) pillars of Performance, Flexibility, Value for Money and Economic Benefits. For more details, visit http://bit.ly/2Qdtpts. "

      December 6, 2018: L3 Technologies posted images on LinkedIn
